comments:
Using build: TPTP-4.1.0-200510130737

I tried profiling a simple java class and opening the class interactions, but
the view shows up empty (white background only), and there is a null pointer
exception printed to stdout. There is instance data there, because the execution
flow view shows data.

osgi> java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.trace.loaders.TraceInteractions.getTraceLif
elineDraftForMethodInvocation(TraceInteractions.java:953)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.trace.loaders.TraceInteractions.createSyncM
essage(TraceInteractions.java:637)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.trace.loaders.TraceInteractions.fillPage(Tr
aceInteractions.java:561)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.trace.loaders.TraceInteractions.parseModel(
TraceInteractions.java:231)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.trace.loaders.BaseTraceInteractions$1.run(B
aseTraceInteractions.java:206)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.ui.load.BackgroundLoader$2.runIt(Background
Loader.java:136)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.ui.load.BackgroundLoader$2.run(BackgroundLo
ader.java:110)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:568)

[Sylvain speaking]: Not reproduced with a class of mine.
Could you please attach your class file and/or profiling file? Thnaks in 
advance.

Tried again with a new build (TPTP-4.1.0-200510140100) and a fresh workspace but
still seeing it. Class file to be attached, as well as a screenshot.

Just to be more precise, here's what I'm doing:

1. Switch to Profiling and Logging perspective, Profile -> Profile...
2. Select External Java Application, localhost:10002, StartStop class (to be
attached), Execution History -> Full Graphical Detail. Click Profile.
3. Hit enter in console until StartStop terminates.
4. Right click on Execution Time Analysis, open with -> UML2 Class Interactions.
5. Blank view appears.

Not reproduced in my env: adding a screenshot attachment of what I'm seeing, 
following your steps.

BTW, the line given in your stack trace seems to indicate that a model 
TRCFullMethodInvocation object has no owningObject (see TraceInteractions.java 
line 909). What can cause this in your env?

Created an attachment (id=28325)
This is the expected result, taht I've got

Sylvain, the owning object will be null in some instances, like Execution no
instances mode, this change happened in 4.1.

Sorry for not notifying you in advance about this change.

[Sylvain speaking]: Fixed in HEAD for 4.1: added more checks and a message to 
say that Object Interactions are degraded when instances are not collected.

Thanks for your help with the remote session.

You may consider talking with Marius about the different behavior between file 
and not-file profiling. Looks like the owningObject of TRFullMethodInvocation 
can be null after some model loading situation.
